mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Tyler, Robert, 1816-1877
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Has just visited with Buchanan; claims that Wise is Buchanan's "favorite" of anyone; reports that Buchanan is troubled in deciding who would be the right man for Secretary of State; refers to Cobb as a possible solution; claims that Forney will do Wise damage; Tyler feels that he and Wise are very close. AL
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1856 December 31, Robert Tyler, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania to Governor Henry A. Wise
